decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays with a mix of burn spells and powerful creatures to put pressure on the opponent. Using Jegantha as a companion provides additional value, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge deal direct damage to control the board. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Amped Raptor offer strong threats, supported by Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer for card advantage. With a mix of land fetch spells and mana fixing, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up its own resources with card draw and efficient removal. Murktide Regent serves as a powerful finisher that can quickly close out games. The deck utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and control the pace of the game. It also includes a few versatile creatures to help stabilize the board and apply pressure when needed.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, coupled with a variety of combat tricks and burn spells to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on buffing up creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler with cards like Scale Up and Mutagenic Growth, while also utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to clear the way for attacks. The deck's goal is to deal damage swiftly and efficiently to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with rituals and medallions, casting spells for free with Ral, Monsoon Mage, and chaining spells together with Past in Flames to generate a storm count. The goal is to ultimately cast Glimpse the Impossible for a large amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes ways to protect itself and filter through the library for combo pieces. It is a fast-paced and explosive combo deck that aims to win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while controlling the game with counter spells like Force of Negation and Counterspell. The deck also utilizes cards like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt for removal, with Preordain and Expressive Iteration for card advantage. The mana base is focused on enabling both red and blue spells, with the potential to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to establish board presence quickly and protect it until victory is achieved.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Galvanic Discharge, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Arena of Glory and Static Prison to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility and consistency to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

The UR Control deck focuses on utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck includes cards like Snapcaster Mage for versatility, Archmage's Charm for controlling the board, Force of Negation for protection, and Subtlety for tempo plays. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Lrien Revealed can help find the key cards needed to control the game. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through attrition.
